context_bundle.summary: Deno runtime features including built-in TypeScript support, secure-by-default permissions, standard library, Fresh framework for edge-rendered applications

onboarding.quick_start: curl -fsSL https://deno.land/install.sh | sh && deno --version && deno run --allow-net https://deno.land/std/examples/welcome.ts
common_patterns: Run script: 'deno run --allow-net --allow-read script.ts' with explicit permissions
Fresh project: 'deno run -A -r https://fresh.deno.dev my-project && cd my-project && deno task start'
Testing: 'Deno.test("addition", () => { assertEquals(1 + 1, 2); });' with built-in test runner
File operations: 'const text = await Deno.readTextFile("./file.txt"); await Deno.writeTextFile("./output.txt", text);'
HTTP server: 'Deno.serve({ port: 8000 }, (req) => new Response("Hello World"));'
Environment variables: 'const apiKey = Deno.env.get("API_KEY");' with --allow-env permission
Subprocess: 'const command = new Deno.Command("ls", { args: ["-la"] }); const { stdout } = await command.output();'
known_errors: Permission denied: Add required permission flags like --allow-net, --allow-read, --allow-write
Module not found: Check URL is correct, use 'deno cache' to pre-download dependencies
Type error: Deno uses strict TypeScript, add type annotations or use 'as' assertions
Import map not working: Create deno.json with 'imports' field, run with 'deno run --import-map=deno.json'
Fresh island not hydrating: Ensure island component is in islands/ directory with default export
Deno Deploy error: Check for Node.js-specific APIs, use Deno-compatible alternatives
